info.title: Jupiter API
info.description: Welcome to Jupiter's ClimateScore Global API

get.description:
Download a stateless SLR file by file ID.

:arg file_id: The file identifier returned from the generate endpoint
:return: Streaming response with the file content

errors.description: The file you have uploaded is not a CSV file. Please upload a valid CSV file.
The file you have uploaded is not populated. Please upload a valid CSV file.

As a trial user you are only entitled to 5 locations across all users within your customer account. This portfolio cannot be processed as either the limit has been reached or the number of locations in this portfolio would exceed the limit.
The file you uploaded is missing a required field: locationId. Please ensure this field is present and capitalized correctly.
The file you uploaded is missing location data. It must have either street address fields or latitude/longitude coordinates. Please ensure these fields are present and capitalized correctly.

One or more of the required fields for this location is incorrectly formatted or missing. Please ensure that the locationId field is present and correctly formatted. Also ensure that location information is provided and formatted correctly (either latitude and longitude coordinates, or street address fields).
This location ID has already been used in this file. Please designate a unique location ID in the locationId field.
This location is out of range. Please ensure that the latitude and longitude are correct.
This location is not on land surface. Please ensure that the latitude and longitude are correct.
No data available for provided coordinates.
This file contains more than 50 errors. Would you like to proceed with the current file? Locations that contain errors will be omitted in the final output report.
The asset value is invalid. Please choose a value >: 0.
The occupancy 'code' is invalid. Valid 'code's are available in the documentation.
Latitude and/or longitude coordinates are whole numbers. Coordinates at the precision of 4 decimal places are recommended to take advantage of the resolution of CSG's climate data.
Please select a portfolio with 50 or fewer locations to run a Flood Mesh analysis.
This option creates a large mesh around the center point. If you are interested in learning more about this feature, please speak to your CSA about upgrading.
Too many warnings were encountered, and subsequent warnings are not individually tracked.
Too many errors were encountered, and subsequent errors are not individually tracked.

detail.msg: value is not a valid uuid

get.description:
Download a unified validation log CSV file for a file validation.
The file contains validation messages from file, row, and location levels.

schema.title: Response Get Shared Users Portfolios  Portfolio Id  Shared Users Get
Response Retrieve Result Set Metadata Result Sets  Result Set Id  Metadata Get

post.description:
Get locations for the result set.
Drives the asset selection screen.
Data is static.

schema.title: Response Post Adaptation Result Set Locations Adaptation Analysis  Analysis Id  Locations Asset Attributes Post

get.description: Get the analysis settings for the provided analysis.

post.description: Update location settings for the analysis.
Update location settings for the analysis.

post.summary: Post Adaptation Analysis Location Selection Strategy State
post.description:
Get strategy settings resolved for the provided selection of locations.
Used by the sidecar.

Get key performance indicators and timeseries data for the analysis.
Data is computed based on the stored settings for each location and the analysis settings.
KPIs are seen across the application, and some of the asset selection summary screen.
Timeseries data is for each analysis year, and drives the AAL progression and capex timelines.

post.summary: Post Adaptation Analysis Id Locations Data
post.description:
Get location data for the result set.
Drives the investment matrix.
Data is computed based on the stored settings for each location.

schema.title: Response Post Adaptation Analysis Id Locations Data Adaptation Analysis  Analysis Id  Locations Analysis Data Post

discount_rate.title: Discount Rate
discount_rate.description: If null, will use the asset's value. In the interface, a 'None' value should be persisted as 0 and a custom value should be persisted as-is.

growth_factor.title: Growth Factor
growth_factor.description: If null, will use the asset's value. In the interface, a 'None' value should be persisted as 0 and a custom value should be persisted as-is.

AdaptationGroup.title: AdaptationGroup
AdaptationGroup.description:
A grouping for adaptation strategies. Strategies under the group are applied to EI modules
defined in the group.

These roughly map to "flooding", "wind", "fire", "heat" in the adaptation PRD, with a
(1:N) (group:ei_module) mapping.

This modeling accommodates cross-"peril" strategies, or no-peril strategies.

An EI module must only appear in one group for an analysis, as combinations are generated on a
per-group basis.

All groups for a result set will be written to the DB.

AdaptationStrategy.title: AdaptationStrategy
AdaptationStrategy.description:
A single adaptation strategy, 1:N group:strategy.

For our V1 implementation:

All strategies for a result set will be written to the DB.

AdaptationStrategyOverrideOptions.title: AdaptationStrategyOverrideOptions
AdaptationStrategyOverrideOptions.description: Adaptation options which provides a set of options and the model overrides they'll apply.

strategies.title: Strategies
strategies.description: Map of strategy keys to typed strategy information

settings_confirmed.title: Settings Confirmed
settings_confirmed.description: Flag for first-time user flow confirmation.

unadapted.title: Unadapted
unadapted.description: A map where each key is a peril (or "all") and the value is a list of AAL values corresponding to the years array.

adapted.title: Adapted
adapted.description: A map where each key is a peril (or "all") and the value is a list of AAL values corresponding to the years array.

value.title: Value
value.description: Strategy value which is consistent and applicable across all locations in the selection

enum: An API error or unexpected result occurred
Multiple partial matches found; using first
Row not checked due to existing lat/lon
GeocodeStatus.title: GeocodeStatus
GeocodeStatus.description: Categorize geocode API responses and match with appropriate log messages

GeocodingInput.title: GeocodingInput
GeocodingInput.description:
Address columns used for geocoding. These should be provided if a location (lat/long) is
omitted.

If both a GeocodingInput and Location are provided, the location will be used.

strategies.title: Strategies
strategies.description: Strategies and their values for the group.

JupiterTemplateInput.title: JupiterTemplateInput
JupiterTemplateInput.description:
The input does not contain the CSG version as we don't want the user to be able to specify a version mismatch.
Version is derived from the result set.

top_performer_npv_location.title: Top Performer Npv Location
top_performer_npv_location.description: The customer_location_id of the top performer.

financial_error.title: Financial Error
financial_error.description: If there was an error during financial computation for the location, this will be populated.

strategies.title: Strategies
strategies.description: A map of a group to its strategies and their values. This structure is TBD, and may change to accommodate e.g. applicability.

country_code_iso2a.title: Country Code Iso2A
country_code_iso2a.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, unvalidated directly from customer input.

occupancy_code.title: Occupancy Code
occupancy_code.description: Maps to the shortOccupancyName per occupancyName_lookup.

entity.title: Entity
entity.description: Unvalidated customer-provided field with per-customer semantics.

admin1_code.title: Admin1 Code
admin1_code.description: Code for the primary administrative subdivision (e.g., state, province).

total_value.title: Total Value
total_value.description: Total value for the location, used for aggregation.

unadapted_aal_2025.title: Unadapted Aal 2025
unadapted_aal_2025.description: Unadapted Average Annual Loss for the year 2025.

location_ids.title: Location Ids
location_ids.description: List of location IDs. If omitted or null, the request applies to all locations.

location_id.title: Location Id
location_id.description: The location ID to update settings for.

strategies.title: Strategies
strategies.description: A map of group IDs to their strategy keys and corresponding option values to apply. An omitted strategy key for a group is assumed to be disabled, i.e. this request is an overwrite and will not reconcile with existing state.

LocationSettingsBody.title: LocationSettingsBody
LocationSettingsBody.description: Request to update a single location's settings.

reason.title: Reason
reason.example: It is infeasible to elevate a building of this scale.

NotApplicableItem.title: NotApplicableItem
NotApplicableItem.description: Represents a location that is not applicable for a strategy.

PipelineModel.title: PipelineModel
PipelineModel.description: Pydantic data model for a Pipeline with all fields that are captured in the Database.

damages_options.title: Damages Options
damages_options.description: Options used to create damages_result_set. These are always overwritten if included in the input.

SingleLocationReportModel.title: SingleLocationReportModel
SingleLocationReportModel.description: Pydantic data model for a SingleLocationReport with all fields that are captured in the Database.

StatelessSingleLocationReportFile.title: StatelessSingleLocationReportFile
StatelessSingleLocationReportFile.description: A stateless SLR file produced by the stateless SLR workflow.

StatelessSingleLocationReportResponse.title: StatelessSingleLocationReportResponse
StatelessSingleLocationReportResponse.description: This model describes the response from the stateless SLR workflow.

location_ids.title: Location Ids
location_ids.description: The list of location IDs to update. Omit to apply to all.

strategies.title: Strategies
strategies.description: A map of group IDs to their strategy keys and corresponding option values to apply. An omitted strategy key for a group is assumed to be disabled, i.e. this request is an overwrite and will not reconcile with existing state.

UpdateBulkLocationSettingsBody.title: UpdateBulkLocationSettingsBody
UpdateBulkLocationSettingsBody.description: Request to update location settings in bulk, e.g. for an adaptation analysis settings selection.

UpdateIndividualLocationSettingsBody.title: UpdateIndividualLocationSettingsBody
UpdateIndividualLocationSettingsBody.description: Request to update location settings for each individual location.

strategy_values.title: Strategy Values
strategy_values.description: Map of strategy values to location IDs with those values.

not_applicable.title: Not Applicable
not_applicable.description: Where this strategy is not applicable, and why

damages_options.description: Options used to create damages_result_set. These are always overwritten if included in the input.
Options used to create damages_result_set. These are always overwritten if included in the input.

SupplementalResultSetOptions.title: SupplementalResultSetOptions
SupplementalResultSetOptions.description:
Customer-facing supplemental result set options. For simplicity's sake these are specified
in a similar manner to perils: customers can't pick and choose per-peril metrics, scenarios,
and years but specify them on the result set level instead.
